snippet: Since a vicious, high-profile attack on several Pakistani schoolgirls in October, the Taliban’s violent campaign against girls’ education in northwestern Pakistan has continued unabated.
abstract: Taliban continues violent campaign against girls' education in northwestern Pakistan after high profile attack in October that left 15-year-old Malala Yousafzai critically injured; many citizens and students have resisted militants' efforts to shut down schools, even while violence has sowed fear among parents and communities.

byline.original: By TAHA SIDDIQUI and DECLAN WALSH
byline.contributor: Taha Siddiqui reported from Ghalanai, and Declan Walsh from London. Sana ul Haq contributed reporting from Swat, Pakistan.

lead_paragraph: Since a vicious, high-profile attack on several Pakistani schoolgirls in October, the Taliban’s violent campaign against girls’ education in northwestern Pakistan has continued unabated.

headline.main: Siege by Taliban Strains Pakistani Girls’ Schools
headline.print_headline: Siege by Taliban Strains Pakistani Girls’ Schools
